title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 August 2013 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
00:33 <polx> has quit  
01:48 <kstuart1> has quit  
03:30 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
05:45 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
06:49 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <polx> has quit  
07:21 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:27 <polx> has quit  
07:28 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <polx> has quit  
08:12 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
08:41 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <vmassol> good morning  
11:43 <vmassol> platform build is failing for me....  
11:43 <vmassol> at  
11:43 <vmassol> LuceneAnalyzerTest.searchWithGermanAnalyzer:209 ? NullPointer  
11:45 <vmassol> strangely it passed when executed in my IDE, so maybe flickering, trying the maven build again  
12:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <sburjan> has quit  
12:23 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <sburjan> hello. does anyone have locally a 5.1 M1 running ? I want to confirm an issue  
13:46 <gdelhumeau> 5.1 M1 or 5.2 M1 ?  
13:47 <gdelhumeau> I can have both  
13:47 <gdelhumeau> has left #xwiki  
13:48 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: it was my cache, sorry for the noise  
15:30 <vmassol> sburjan: hi  
15:30 <sburjan> vmassol: hi  
15:31 <vmassol> would be great if msmeria or you could test the AS cleanup feature  
15:31 <vmassol> in xwiki.cfg there's a config to comment out to enable AS cleanup  
15:31 <vmassol> someone reported that it doesn't seem to be working anymore  
15:32 <vmassol> mail thread: "[xwiki-users] ActivityStreamCleanerJob"  
15:40 <sburjan> vmassol: we are currently working on something else. We'll try to do it this week.  
15:40 <vmassol> ok thanks  
15:40 <vmassol> I'm letting you answer that thread, ok?  
15:41 <sburjan> I'll try to help, but  I never worked with this, didn't even know we even had this feature :)  
15:42 <vmassol> exactly which is why I'm asking you to test it :)  
15:42 <vmassol> (so that you get to know it and can validate it works)  
15:42 <sburjan> yes, I know :)  
15:42 <vmassol> don't forget it, I'm removing it from my list now and I won't remember it, you're now the owner of it!  
15:42 <vmassol> :)  
15:43 <sburjan> ok :) I'll pass it back if I won't be able to reproduce  
15:43 <vmassol> ok  
15:50 <msmeria> has quit  
16:05 <sburjan> vmassol: I have a question just to make sure I understood properly. If a translation in a certain language is missing, I should create a issue on xwikiorg project, and if a key is missing I should report a bug to the corresponding project where the code is ?  
16:06 <vmassol> there's no xwikiorg project  
16:06 <vmassol> there's an XINFRA one though  
16:06 <vmassol> but I wouldn't do that  
16:06 <vmassol> I wouldn't report it I mean  
16:06 <vmassol> it's normal that translations are missing  
16:07 <vmassol> that's the point of l10n to show what's missing  
16:07 <sburjan> well I started testing which translations do not work in german. and I was told I have to report issues. orders from above  
16:07 <vmassol> wdym by "do not work"?  
16:07 <sburjan> I was just talking to manuel that what we are doing is somehow pointless since it is possible to see which translations are missing for german language from l10n  
16:08 <vmassol> yes it's 100% bad  
16:08 <vmassol> to report missing keys  
16:08 <sburjan> meaning that when I switch to german, I still get them in english  
16:08 <vmassol> it's even worse than not doing anything  
16:08 <vmassol> if you want to see which transaltions are missing there's a link for that  
16:09 <vmassol> (a l10n url )  
16:09 <vmassol> there's nothing to test either  
16:09 <vmassol> l10n does that for you  
16:09 <sburjan> I don't know german, so I can't translate them.  
16:09 <vmassol> and?  
16:09 <vmassol> what's the realtion with what I said?  
16:09 <sburjan> I totally agree  
16:10 <vmassol> so I think you've lisunderstood somehting  
16:10 <sburjan> none, I get your POV. I think the same  
16:10 <vmassol> \*misunderstood  
16:10 <vmassol> what you can do is generate a report (email or wiki page) of the current status of all languages and # of missing translations  
16:10 <vmassol> but this has nothing to do with JIRA  
16:11 <sburjan> yes, I know. Silvia told me to report issues with missing keys or translations. This is why I asked where to report in JIRA  
16:11 <vmassol> missing keys is something else  
16:11 <vmassol> missing keys means the code is not internationalized  
16:11 <vmassol> so this needs to be reported in jira  
16:12 <sburjan> yes, I'll report those. I only h ave 2 of them  
16:12 <sburjan> thanks vmassol  
16:13 <vmassol> np  
16:20 <evalica> has left #xwiki  
16:20 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:40 <polx> has quit  
16:44 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:02 <polx> has quit  
17:10 <evalica> vmassol: I don't know why it need right after the title, because maybe it's too late if you put it after  
17:11 <vmassol> evalica: well you need to find out  
17:11 <evalica> would you like to link in the code the stackoverflow answer?  
17:11 <vmassol> yes that's ok  
17:11 <evalica> ….. I don't think is very nice to have links in the code :|  
17:11 <vmassol> it's better to explain  
17:11 <vmassol> and put a link for more details  
17:11 <evalica> well the JIRA issue is for more details  
17:12 <vmassol> like for ex if there's a full page of details  
17:12 <vmassol> you're not going to copy paste it in the code  
17:12 <vmassol> but a 1-5 lines of explanations is good in the code  
17:12 <vmassol> the idea is that whoever looks at the code can understand the reason  
17:13 <evalica> in theory I understand what you mean, but I disagree for this issue. I still the comment is enough and I don't think every decision in XWiki is well explained and commented  
17:13 <vmassol> no  
17:13 <vmassol> definitely not  
17:13 <vmassol> you said:  
17:13 <vmassol>  "placed right after the title"  
17:13 <vmassol> this is very very very bad  
17:13 <vmassol> it doesn't mean anything  
17:13 <vmassol> it seems to say that it's important to be after the title  
17:13 <vmassol> but it doesn't say so explicitly  
17:13 <vmassol> whether it's needed  
17:13 <evalica> well I put it in another place and didn't worked : )  
17:14 <vmassol> or is just a void comment  
17:14 <vmassol> you cannot code at random caty  
17:14 <vmassol> :(  
17:14 <vmassol> you need to understand what you're doing  
17:14 <vmassol> at the very minimum you need a big large comment  
17:14 <vmassol> to explain that you don't understand why it needs to be there  
17:14 <vmassol> but that it doesn't work if not there  
17:15 <vmassol> ofc it's better that you spend the time to understand why obviously  
17:15 <vmassol> ;)  
17:15 <vmassol> otherwise yo'ure just pushing that answer to the next dev  
17:15 <vmassol> but not putting anything is really bad  
17:15 <evalica> well I suspect why .. but i don't know were to find the official 'documentation' of the reason why in order to reference it  
17:15 <evalica> \*where  
17:15 <vmassol> this is what's killing us in lots of places in the old core FTR  
17:15 <evalica> well there is a link in the JIRA issue  
17:15 <vmassol> sigh  
17:16 <evalica> is not 'nothing'  
17:16 <vmassol> how am I suposed to know that by looking at the code?  
17:21 <vmassol> the more documentation you add to your code to help the next code, the better it is… you should try to modify old core stuff and you'll tear your hair and you'll curse whoever wrote it for several generations just asking yourself why the guy didn't spend 1 minute to add some comments…. ;)  
17:21 <vmassol> s/code/coder/  
17:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:22 <vmassol> as you progress in coding (especially OSS) you'll realize more and more that you're not coding for yourself but for the others and you'll be more and more careful about how you write code so that there's less WTF moment later on...  
17:32 <sburjan> has quit  
17:45 <evalica> vmassol: hope is better like this  
17:46 <vmassol> thanks caty, sorry to be a pita  
17:46 <evalica> thanks vincent :) np - you were right - I'm glad I found the specification :P  
17:46 <vmassol> :)  
17:58 <polx> has quit  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:48 <evalica> has quit
